definition: to disappear/to vanish/to eliminate/to spend (time)/have to/need
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: That's where the creation of groups of sources comes in.
sentences.chinese: 這也正是對消息來源進行分組的價值所在。

sentences.english: You must not  presume too much on the reliability of such sources.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該過分指望這類消息來源的可靠性。

sentences.english: Having sworn my source to protective secrecy as well, I declined to say.
sentences.chinese: 由於承諾要對消息來源加以保護和保密，我拒絕說明。

sentences.english: Ha Tae-keung is president of Open Radio for North Korea, which says it relies on sources in the North.
sentences.chinese: 開放北韓廣播電臺據說有來自北韓的消息來源。

sentences.english: Sources from the Boke a real estate industry source.
sentences.chinese: 消息來源自某房地產業內權威人士的博客。

sentences.english: That's really the very reliable source.
sentences.chinese: 那才真正是非常可靠的消息來源。

sentences.english: Protection of journalistic sources is one of the basic conditions for press freedom.
sentences.chinese: 保護記者的消息來源是新聞自由的基本條件之一。

definition: Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
South China Morning Post (newspaper in Hong Kong)
Mainichi Shimbun, a Japanese daily newspaper

Nikkei Shimbun, Japanese equivalent of Financial Times
